column4: Hi everyone! I'm trying to use Citrix ICA client and keep getting this error. /usr/lib/ICAClient/wfica: error while loading shared libraries: libXaw.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
did you try looking in the synaptic pkg mgr for the libXaw?
Just tried a quick check for the libXaw ver 7 is installed, ver 6 is available but not installed
assuming that is the right library
I know this is present in this RPM: XFree86-libs-3.3.2pl2-1.i386.rpm
Hmmm fsantos sounds like could be a library path thing then, though can you find the files other than in the rpm? check LD_LIBRARY_PATH maybe?
how do I check if a certain lib is installed?
I have run a find and got libXaw.so.7
as soon as a computer system has to talk to paper you are asking for trouble :o)
fsanstos: do you have the synaptic GUI package mgr?
yes. I'm looking at it but can't find which package contains that lib... The RPM I mentioned eralier was found using google but I do not want to install it as I may break something.
in the synaptic mgr just click search and enter libaw6
it has the lovely ubuntu family circle by it in on my system fsantos so it part of the main ( I think )
yes gaim supports MSN but aMSN is a nicer interface
Well it's as ugly as the windoze version I guess, Spiral :o)
Dude... You just made my day! Thank you for showing me the obvious... ;-) I was trying to browse for it and couldn't find it anywhere. Search worked just fine! Excellent!
